data.title: No Paninis...but isn't that like 90% of your menu
data.text: The mostly teenage staff stared at us for about 4 minutes before someone finally acknowledged us. The young lady who did finally come up didn't greet us just looked at us and asked "are you gonna order or.." So I wanted a panini and a grilled cheese for our son...her response was the machine that makes that is broke...for real...because I saw lots of customers and they had sandwiches...I am from Atlanta and our locations are usually cleaner, brighter and much more helpful.

data.title: Very neat but why bother.
data.text: The lack of interest in serving a good food product is so obviously not important to this factory food establishment. You're better off nuking some hot pockets and stuffing them in your face hole on the couch. (FYI I've never had a hot pocket, but I'm sure it's better)

data.title: Quick decent food - good for on the run
data.text: This place is basically a healthier Panera Bread.  We needed somewhere quick to grab a light lunch on the way to the beach. We stopped in here as got half a sandwich and a half salad. Took no more than 20 minutes for the whole process. Great Greek salad. Good grab and go option!

data.title: Just another chain
data.text: Nothing special. Near the mall. They have updated the outside and in. For a chain it is okay for a quick bite to eat.

data.title: Surprised to find it.
data.text: We used to eat at Atlanta Bread in Asheville all the time, then we discovered Panera. However, our trip to the Mt. Pleasant AB was very good. Our salads were very fresh and tasty. The place was clean and well kept up. the staff was friendly and efficient. We would recommend reconnecting with AB when you are in Mt. Pleasant.

data.title: Not So Great Expectations
data.text: I went here last month thinking it was a Panera Bread.  I gave it a shot though and wasn't all that thrilled.  The service was fine but the food just didn't have much taste.  I'm a Panera fan though so maybe this isn't a fair review.

data.title: Best veg sandwich!!
data.text:
If you are looking for a non-meat sandwich option, the avocado/cheese sandwich here is delicious!  They add lettuce, tomato, red onion and a fabulous dill sauce -- yum!!
I would have given it a rating of 5, except my daughter's food was never delivered.  I had to go up to the counter to have them make it -- they couldn't figure out where it went originally.   Otherwise, we enjoyed our lunch.

data.title: Soup and Sandwich - What else?
data.text: With a choice of 4-5 soups ever day, and over 20 sandwiches to choose from, it's hard to go hungry here. (Oh, and BTW, the salads are great, too,)

data.title: Stopped to pick up a bite for breakfast
data.text:
Wow, really turned off. 
Looked like a Panara that we frequent in Cincinnati.
NOT EVEN CLOSE!
One would think the variety of Bagels would be MUCH better.
No Poppy Seed, no Chocolate Chip?
Bought my wife a Seame Seed bagel. She threw it away.
Build g looks like a Panara, but no other comparison.

data.title: Panera it is not
data.text: Bread good. Sandwiches average. Looks like Panera and has a similar menu but is not as good overall   The turkey club panini had very little turkey on it. The chicken salad sandwich had extra mayo  Why?

data.title: Down sizing?
data.text: They used to have the largest sandwiches that were so tasty, but last time we ate there, the sandwiches were smaller with less meat on them. Still tasty

data.title: Quick lucnh
data.text: Very good location to all your shopping.  Clean but staff needs to pick up their friendliness.  The food was good.  Would highly recommend the watermelon/feta salad

data.title: Lunch - Quick and Easy.
data.text:
Quick and tasty lunch.
Good service at reasonable prices.
Great break for lunch while shopping.
Varied menu.

data.title: Quality below average
data.text: I usually eat in Panera Bread; as we don't have Atlanta Breads in Charlotte. So, I haven't eaten in an Atlanta Bread for 2 yrs. We were visiting the area, so picked Atlanta Bread, as it was always decent & reliable. . I always thought Atlanra bread was a touch better than Panera; but not so at this location.  Ordered the baked potato soup & salad combo.  Soup was barely lukewarm, viscous, heavily thickened to the point of it being glue like & tasted only of faux bacon seasonings. Borderline disgusting. The salad greens were also luke warm, limp & looked like they'd been sitting out unrefrigerated for some time.  I asked for the soup to be re-warmed & got a scowl in return. It came back barely warmer than when I gave it it to them, no improvement. The staff were clearly bored & barely went through the motions.  Very disappointing. For me Atlanta Bread & Panera offer reliable decent average food.  This Atlanta Bread was a negative exception & I wouldn't recommend eating here. My hubby had a panini & the bread was stale & it was also served barely warm.

data.title: Sandwich good, service slow, soup bad
data.text: Title kind of covers it, ordered a turkey sandwich, tasty , but mostly bread. Clam chowder ,one thick, wall paper past mess, never should have been served. We were on tight schedule so we pushed it aside. Place wasn't crowded but service was very slow.

data.title: Great soup and wifi too
data.text: I was looking for a place to hang out for an afternoon when I had to check out of my hotel. I got a lot of work done and had a good sandwich and great French onion Soup. The service was nice and the food hit the spot. no one cared that I was there for 4 hours. it was very comfortable and helpful.

data.title: Good food-but not quite up to par of usual ABC
data.text: The veggie sandwich didn't have the sprouts we are used to. Also, for the panini, they were out of the panini bread (part of the appeal of that!), and had to substitute other bread. Good but not quite the same. They might need to be more diligent about replenishing supplies! : )

data.title: chaos
data.text:
What a mess.  Maybe that it was a busy Saturday evening and they were understaffed.. but it was not all the businesses fault... the patrons contributed as well:  There was an overabundance of annoying sub 8-year old ADHD kids with clueless parents (for example one parent let their child blow a whistle for 10-minutes).  And if that was not bad enough, apparently the local assisted living center emptied their rooms as the other half of the patrons were psychotropic dependent seniors who had not qualms about stepping all over your stuff or bumping the back of your seat.  It made me wonder if the place didn't exceed the fire marshall's limite on numbers of occupants, it was so darn crowded.

Food came out sort of slow and they missed on an order, neglecting to come out with a beverage we ordered.  After 12-minutes on line again, I got the cup of chocolate milk, only to return to a cold soup.

Food was not special enought to warrant a return (ever).

SaleebScore:  Food:  5/10;   Service: 6/10;   Value: Poor;  Atmosphere: (during busy): poor.

Overall impression and recommendations:  Avoid.

data.title: Always Good . . .
data.text: Somewhat crowded on a usual basis, but the take-out is normally quick and easy.  A good selection of soups and sandwiches.  The prices are reasonable.

data.title: Just like a panera bread
data.text: This is just like a panera bread if you've been to one. It's got your sandwiches, salads and soups. It's in a nice location and decent prices. Food was good but just like a panera to me
